Your courtiers keep saying you got scammed by the “servant” of Mwizi, “Prince” of Abyssinia. One day, however, he returns with a large chest of gold. “Thank you for helping us in our time of need,” the man tells you. “Mwizi is most happy, and has taken refuge in Hindustan, but wishes to give you your fair share.”
Ha! I knew it! My trust was well placed.

Oh! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] have mercy, I should’ve never ate that! It was definitely a bad idea buying that cheap baklava from the baklava merchant. It seems like it was really old and spoiled - no wonder he sold it at such a low price.
I’m starting to feel really sick…

One of my close servants seems rather sullen lately, so I asked him if anything was wrong. He told me he recently was sent by my cook to buy a pig. He bought what he thought was a healthy piglet in a bag for a really low price. However, it turned out the bag contained not a piglet, but a cat.
Haha, that scam! Everyone knows about that one.
Tell me who did it. I’ll find him and punish him!
I got deceived by that con several times, actually.
I’ve received damning evidence revealing that one of my servants is one of the more well-to-do smugglers in the region. No wonder he always seems so happy and well-to-do compared to the others!
What he does is none of my concern.
Expel him from my castle, but do no more.
Imprison him! He may have useful information.

“A true relic of the city’s patron saint! See for yourself!” The merchant smiles through his crooked teeth as he shows me the bone. As I observe the bone, its ridges and its texture, the merchant continues, “This belonged to our saint, certainly, and I will give it to you for an affordable price.”
I’ll buy it!
No… I have a bad feeling about this.
That’s obviously a pig’s bone. What a fraud!
This will impress quite a lot of people. A holy relic!
I happily show everyone the relic I bought for cheap, but one of my learned and more intelligent courtiers laughs as he proves that it is merely a pig’s bone. I was deceived!
Throw away that useless thing, I have no need for it now.

Peasants are always superstitious, and the appearance of a comet in the sky has caused panic among your people. They are convinced that this is a sign that the end of times is near or that something bad is going to happen in the near future due to your "inept" rule.
It's an omen!
Stop looking at the sky!
There hasn't been a comet or any such similar omen in such a long time, people are beginning to wonder whether this is a good sign from the heavens.
It's a sign!
Stop looking at the sky!
A comet has recently been sighted, but the astrologers say that due to various factors it is actually a good omen for once!
I'm not complaining.
Stop looking at the sky!
Tonight I and a few courtiers are stargazing. Suddenly, one exclaims, “I think I saw a comet in the sky! That’s bad news!”
For the love of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], will you people just stop with the comets?
Heavens have mercy! I think I see it too! We’re doomed!
I asked my nanny why everyone is running around in a frenzy. “A comet in the sky!” she exclaims. “Look! There! It’s an omen from the heavens, surely meaning the end of days! We’re all going to die!”
AAAAAHHHH!!!
Those stupid adults are scared by a big light in the sky?
That’s the most boring thing I’ve ever seen.
Stop looking at the sky and get back to work!

Whenever people see a comet they go into a frenzy and think the end of the world is nigh - and they say I am the one who’s insane? Well, I’ve had enough of this nonsense. I’ll directly communicate with [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and give the heavens a piece of my mind.
Hey, old friend, we need to talk…
My friends keep telling me I’m cuckoo for comets.

My attempts to contact the heavens was unsuccessful at first, but eventually I managed to talk a bit with [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], who said that following my reasonable complaints the amount of comets in the sky will be reduced significantly for a while.
Thank goodness! Now everybody can stop looking at the sky.

My attempts to contact the heavens was unsuccessful at first, but eventually I managed to talk a bit with [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], who said that my complaints were so annoying that the amount of comets in the sky will be increased significantly for a while.
Curses! I should have... By the heavens, did I just see a comet?
Like many men, I enjoy a good hunt. Yet I’ve come to realize how the hunting of animals for sport clashes with the teachings of the Buddha, who taught that one should not take life.
It’s just an ideal. Death is the natural way of life!
That’s right… I don’t feel so eager about hunting anymore…

I have heard reports of a wise and great teacher, knowledgeable in the Dharma, who lives in the wilderness not too far from my residence. Seeking to learn from him, I sent an envoy to this master, requesting that he come to my court. Upon returning, my envoy told me that this great master was not interested in coming.
As a result the teacher mysteriously vanishes without a trace...
Tell him if he doesn’t come, I’ll bring my warriors to punish him!
Very well. I’ll respect his decision, and won’t bother him anymore.

Although I’m currently not on a meditation retreat, I think it’s important I continue my spiritual practice, so I’ve decided to take the day off to meditate and practice calming my mind. I tell my servants not to disturb me, lock my doors, sit down by my small bedside altar, and close my eyes.
Let’s begin...

The death of one of my bodyguards deeply disturbed me. This man was a trusted friend and confidante! “I’d do anything to get him back,” I told one of the monks at the funeral. The holy man replied, “All beings must die. You will die, I will die - everyone will die. If you don’t understand this, you will continue to suffer.”
But… how can I live without my friend?
That’s true. I can’t be too attached to the memory of my friend.

You are lucky to have a renowned but usually reclusive monk and meditation master visit today. You ask him, “How much merit have I earned for supporting the Buddhist faith in this country?” He replies, “None,” before unceremoniously leaving.
What a charlatan!
I think I just gained a bit of insight.

A monk accompanies me today as I am traveling to one of my realm’s fortresses. As we stop by a small river to gather water, I notice a scorpion drowning in the water. The monk picks it up and is stung before he sets it aside on the ground. “Why do you save it,” I ask, “If you know it is in the scorpion’s nature to sting?”
“Because,” the monk replies, “It is my nature to save.”
My servants report that several monks are outside my residence begging for alms. They seem to be very persistent.
Away, vile beggars!
Give them some of our leftovers.
Give them some good, freshly made food.

Your devout wife insists on lighting incense everywhere in my residence in order to encourage a spiritual atmosphere. Her devotion to the Dharma is admirable, but the ever-present, suffocating smoke is annoying a lot of people and making their lives miserable - you included.
Tell her to stop lighting incense.
Tell she is causing others to suffer, which goes against Buddhist doctrine.
What she does is none of my concern.

Today an important foreign dignitary visited the court. Though it wasn’t easy, I managed to impress this dignitary with my ability in conversation. My guardian has taught me quite a lot about talking with others!
I was pretty nervous though.

Today an important foreign dignitary visited the court. How impressed I was when my ward managed to engage in a sophisticated discussion with this dignitary. My ward has learned quite a bit about the art of conversation from me.
I am very proud.

Recently, my guardian takes me with [Root.Guardian.GetHerHim] whenever we travel around the country. I hear boring lectures about what people trade, the crops the peasants grow, what happens inside cities and ports…
My guardian says this will be important to me later on.

Recently, I’ve taken my ward with me when I traveled around the country, visiting different villages, castles, and cities. I constantly explain to my ward how people trade, what sort of crops we grow on the land, and so on.
It’s important my ward learns these things.

Adults can be so cruel and petty, always scheming against each other for one reason or another! That’s why my guardian takes time to explain to me what exactly they’re up to, so I won’t grow up to be naive.
I’ve learned a lot about intrigue.

My ward isn’t usually involved in court intrigue, so I fear that the child might grow to be too naive. Thus, whenever some of the other courtiers engage in suspicious activities or gossip, I always make sure to explain their true intentions and schemes to my ward.
I do so away from the others, of course.

My guardian is very demanding. [Root.Guardian.GetSheHe] always wants me to read these books or scrolls about boring stuff like “natural philosphy” even though I want to do other things like play with my friends.
Though I will admit some of it is really interesting…

I think it’s important that my ward gain a better understanding of the arts and sciences. A well-rounded person will always do better, after all, so the child is made to read texts on subjects ranging from natural philosophy to history and theology.
Not that I expect the child to understand it all…

A month ago you bought some baklava from a traveling baklava merchant. Today you wished to share some of it with a visiting dignitary, but to your horror you realize the baklava has spoiled. Unfortunately, it’s too late - the dignitary eats a few of the delicacies and begins puking for a while afterwards.
I’m so sorry! I’ll buy fresher baklava next time!

A while back I sentenced a commoner to death for a heinous crime. Today, I’ve just learned he was actually framed by a rival. Though I have arrested and ordered the execution of this rival, the wrongful execution of an innocent man is a stain on my honor and ability as a ruler.
Not good news at all.

In the middle of a meeting with your courtiers, you accidentally bite your tongue as you try to speak. In the midst of your pain, you shout some curses and other nasty words. Though you eventually calm down, everyone is surprised at your sudden outburst - surely, you normally don’t talk like a sailor, do you?
Whoops.
I’ve received news that one of my associates has been convicted of fraud, among other things. This is surely a stain on my reputation as a businessman!
I have to minimize the damage as much as I can.

It is time for breakfast. When you make your way to the main eating hall where your courtiers are assembled, you notice they are looking at you strangely. Then, you suddenly realize that you did not properly put on your clothes, and parts of your lower body are showing. How embarrassing!
Better run back to my room and readjust that.
My nanny says I shouldn’t eat worms, even though they’re so tasty!
My stomach hurts...
The crickets are chirping and singing quite loudly tonight, more so than usual. This is a rather odd occurrence… maybe it’s a bad omen, like another comet? Or perhaps it is a good one?
Their music is beautiful - this is a good thing!
I can’t go to sleep - this is terrible!
It was supposed to be a peaceful, quick walk in your garden. Then you got stung by a group of angry bees.
Ouch! I shouldn’t have walked in that direction!
I have to get a few herbs to soothe the wound.

I just saw a lot of ladybugs outside in my private gardens, more so than usual! A good thing, as the old [Root.Culture.GetName] elders say, for ladybugs are bringers of good luck and indicate one’s wishes will soon be fulfilled.
Good, good.

You’ve lived in Egypt long enough to notice that many of the ancient, pagan monuments often have depictions of beetles, be it as statues or wall paintings. The locals say the pagans worshipped dung beetles.
Disgusting! The pagans are truly barbarians!
One of my courtiers has a strange habit of squishing bugs whenever there are any nearby. “It’s a lot of fun, killing these wretched things, seeing them scurry around in fear!” my courtier says.
We should love God’s creation, not destroy it!
We should respect these industrious beings, not destroy them!
You are very childish.
Fun? I want to join in on the fun!
